frame.name: FR_Commerce_scenario
frame.definition: <def-root>Commerce is a situation in which a <fen>Buyer</fen> and a <fen>Seller</fen> have agreed upon an exchange of <fen>Money</fen> and <fen>Goods</fen> (possibly after a negotiation), and then perform the exchange, optionally carrying it out with various kinds of direct payment or financing or the giving of change. <ex></ex> The <fen>Seller</fen> indicates their willingness to give the <fen>Goods</fen> in their possession to a <fen>Buyer</fen> who would give them some amount of <fen>Money</fen>. The <fen>Seller</fen> may have already decided on the amount of money that they would require, in which case it is called the Asking price. <ex></ex> The <fen>Buyer</fen> also indicates their willingness to give an amount of money called an Offer to a <fen>Seller</fen> who would give them the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex></ex> Normally the process is begun by the <fen>Seller</fen>. The means by which the <fen>Seller</fen> indicates their wish to engage in an exchange are various, ranging from putting a price tag on an item on a store shelf, to advertizing, to communicating directly and specifically with a possible <fen>Buyer</fen>. In some cases, however, the process may be initiated by the <fen>Buyer</fen> indicating to a possible <fen>Seller</fen> that they would like to make an exchange. <ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> : Commerce_scenario with FE modifications: the French LUs in this frame do not syntactically mark which of the participants is the Seller and which is the Buyer, hence these FEs were replaced with Participant_1, Participant_2 and Participants. </def-root>

FE.name: Participant_1
FE.definition: <def-root>The most syntactically salient participant in a commercial transaction. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="P1">L'amiral Miaoulis</fex> a forcé le blocus de Nelson pour <t>commercer</t> avec Marseille.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participant_2
FE.definition: <def-root>The least syntactically salient participant in a commercial transaction. <ex>FR-EX: L'amiral Miaoulis a forcé le blocus de Nelson pour <t>commercer</t> avec <fex name="P2">Marseille</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Participants
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Participants</fen> are exchanging <fen>Money</fen> for <fen>Goods</fen>, the information about who originally had the <fen>Goods</fen> and the <fen>Money</fen> is not known.</def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Money</fen> is given in exchange for <fen>Goods</fen> in a transaction. <ex>The <t>price</t> of the sweater <m>was</m> <fex name="Mny"> $50</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Goods</fen> is anything including labor or time, for example, which is exchanged for <fen>Money</fen> in a transaction. <ex>She was considered a <t>purchaser</t> <fex name="Gds">of the finest things</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex> The authorities cut tomato <t>prices</t> <fex name="Rate"> to a dollar per pound</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>The <t>price</t> of Bob's peppers is determined <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

frameRelation.type: Relation to FN1.5: Is Close to
